review.itemreviewed: Gara Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: The leg band grip is too narrow. The legs hike up and it’s super annoying. Would not recommend.
review.name: Leg bands too narrow

review.itemreviewed: Gara Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I’m 5’9, 163lbs with measurements that are in line with a size small. I like tight fitting bibs but these were almost cutting off circulation to my legs. The padding is also very light compared with other brands. Also, as with the other comment the leg grippers aren’t branded as shown in the photo. Was excited when I bought but sadly disappointed when they arrived. 
Will be returning.
review.name: Sizing all wrong

review.itemreviewed: Gara Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I ordered these in medium because i had an early version in large and the compression wasn’t as tight as i like. The medium fit much better although a little tight initially. I’m 5’11” 185-190 athletic build. 

My complaint is tat the bibs leg grippers aren’t brand as shown in the picture. Also I ordered grey and they are closer to charcoal than grey. Otherwise pretty good for entry level bibs.
review.name: Close but not quite

name: Gara Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's

description: Buy the Nite Ize GoLit Rechargeable Visibility Light online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: GoLit Rechargeable Visibility Light
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nite Ize GoLit Rechargeable Visibility Light online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I wish that this product was updated through to use USB-C charging instead of micro-USB.  This is literally the only product I have that still uses micro-USB. I got it as a gift and would like to purchase more of them-- but don't want to have to carry around a special cable in our camping charge kit just for one device when everything else uses a modern standard.
review.name: Good light for tracking items in the dark

review.reviewBody: I put these GoLit's on each side of the seat stays on my bike. It gives great visibility on the sides of the bike. I have plenty of light shooting ahead and behind, but the side coverage is very important too. Rear lights are typically red so I like to set this to green, but having multiple color options is great. I also wear the rechargeable SlapLit's on my arms. If someone hits me they definitely won't be able to say they didn't see me! Both of these products are also great for keeping an eye on kids in the dark. We had our kids wear NitIze products on Halloween and it was extremely helpful!!
review.name: Great for cycling

name: GoLit Rechargeable Visibility Light

review.reviewBody: Seems to be great quality. Pockets galore and venting. The Jacket in XXL is perfect and roomy for me. Looking forward to wearing it this season.
review.name: Whitesoace 2L Jacket

review.reviewBody:
Jacket seems nice. Runs a little large so don’t be afraid to buy true to size if you’re planning to wear a few layers underneath. 

That being said, I would not buy this jacket solely because of how terrible the front zipper is. Almost every zip in either direction would catch and end up getting jammed on the jacket material. In the cold, with gloves on, and snow packed around the zipper, this would be an absolute nightmare to get zipped. Absolute garbage zipper. Ended up sending it back before I even tried to use it outdoors because I didn’t feel like I could trust it to hold up or function properly. If they fix that, the jacket would be a good purchase.
review.name: Zipper sucks

review.reviewBody: I would give this a lot higher of a rating if the main zipper didn't suck

review.reviewBody: Bought this helmet because it was a MIPS helmet with the added feature of the shell available.  The optional shell greatly helps in winter by closing off air flow through the vents, resulting in a warmer noggin.  Price point on sale made this an attractive option for winter/summer riding.  Although I am not a fan of the Lazer knob adjustment system on the back top of the helmet, it's not a deal killer.  Overall, great option for all year riding.
review.name: Good value helmet

review.reviewBody: I have nothing negative to say about this helmet. It checks all the boxes for my requirements (light, good fit, great ventilation, great retention system, style & looks). Over the years, I've trended toward black or dark gray helmets, and typically get a roasted noggin on hot summer days. Going to a white helmet makes a very noticeable difference in reflecting heat. I also like the trim, close fit and great visibility when in a tuck position. Well worth the money, and I'd buy another.
review.name: Excellent helmet, great fit

review.reviewBody:
After much fiddling, I managed to figure out how to adjust the retention system so the basket comes down lower on the back of my head. But this required removing the mips liner and then replacing it which is super annoying. 
Even with that though, I never feel like this helmet is truly snug. The knob on the top is annoying and doesn't move as easily as the typical mechanism at the top of the neck that most helmets have.  I think it is snug, it just doesn't feel like it. I think I will continue to use it for road and gravel but look for something else for mountain biking where the thought that my helmet isn't 100% snug is too much of a distraction on the trail. 

This is unfortunate because Virginia tech gives lazer helmets, especially this one, incredibly good ratings.
review.name: Airy but the retention system needs work

review.reviewBody: This helmet is a great, low-profile helmet with all the protection of MIPS at an unbeatable price! I haven't gotten to try it in warmer weather to test out the breathability yet, but I will update this review as soon as it warms up and I'm able to get out in something where I'm not trying to limit airflow and stay warm.
review.name: Light and Comfortable at a great price!

name: Sphere Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: I love the features and the color! Mainly the adjustable vents, adjustable tightness, and removable fuzzy ears. I’m glad I went up to this model for those conveniences, but don’t feel I’m missing anything for my level of resort skiing.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Freewheel 5L Hip Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this as soon as you released it and took it on a mtb trip to Guatemala. First, it was a great small carry on for the plane - I could carry my water, book, jacket, and some snacks. But most importantly, it was exactly right for the rides. We were riding for several hours, so I carried my tools, phone, snacks, water bottle and small water bladder, and sometimes a light jacket. The phone pocket on the hip strap is well placed for accessibility and didn't get as dusty as I expected through the mesh. I'm 5'2", so the pack looks bulky on me, yet I never really noticed it was there. I didn't need to use the external mesh knee pad storage while riding, but I love that option and that it stows away. This is going to be the perfect pack for epic backcountry rides in the Giff.
review.name: Perfect for longer rides

name: Freewheel 5L Hip Pack

review.reviewBody: I've used White Lightning and Rock-n-Roll Gold, but I prefer this chain lube. I live in an arid environment, so the Dry Chain Lube is the one I use most, though I have used the Wet Chain Lube when I'm riding where I know I'll encounter wet conditions. The chain lube goes on nicely and evenly through the container's applicator. I have no chain noise when using it.
review.name: My chain lube of choice

review.reviewBody: Used this product for years on my road bike. Never thought about it much, the drive train was relatively silent after lubing so nothing to complain about. But then I started seeing pretty extreme wear on the chain(s), measured using the Park Tool wear indicator. Still did not think much of it, it must have been my extreme power output :-). But after stumbling across the independent testing data from Zero Friction cycling, it became pretty obvious this is not the lube for me.
review.name: Not recommended

review.reviewBody: My LBS was out of my go-to lube so I tried this and I'm very happy I did. Seems to do really well with the dry, dusty trails in Utah. I'm not a fan of candy-scented lubes but I give this a pass because of how much I like its performance.
review.name: New favorite

name: Dry Chain Lube

review.reviewBody:
Fits great. Super high quality. Little bit longer in the body than the old one I had and that is a good improvement for wearing around town. 
Love it!!!
Excellent as proven years after years!
review.name: Excellent as allways!

review.reviewBody:
The jacket is great; however it should to be improved in the following ways:

The giant logo on the sleeve is ugly and unnecessary. Please remove. 

The orange hood is ugly and unnecessary. 

(Why is Simms making jackets so anglers can be seen by helicopter pilots, or anyone/thing else? At best it’s counterintuitive to being stealthy and unnoticeable to fish and game; at worst it’s catering to elitist anglers. Thee designs are Ty for guides… Guides using helicopters carry technology these days to be found, and red flags still exist.)

Great outdoor features. Yet, I was very surprised when I noticed there is no net clip on the back. A must have in my opinion.  It's the first time I experienced something like this with a fishing jacket.
I wore this jacket on a salt water trip in chilly weather and it was amazing as a top layer wind break. Very well made. Great features. Happy I made the investment.
review.name: Awesome gear addition!

review.reviewBody: This is the best jacket I have ever bought. Heavy duty build construction but yet very light. Not only do I wear it with my waders fishing, but also wear it in town and every day use.

review.reviewBody: Live in MT and work in the backcountry around the Beartooths. This thing does not work, even in large meadows with direct sky line of sight it will not even send a check in.. just failes everytime. Only seems to work if you have cell reception.
review.name: Not for backcountry use

review.reviewBody: The device overall is ok in my opinion. It basically works. I found it kind of confusing to get it set up. It worked basically as advertised. The battery ran out just a bit faster than it said. The big problem with this device is that Zoleo is super aggressive about billing. I thought there was a free trial period. The problem is that they require 90 days notice to cancel. So, if you ever use the device, you will have to pay Zoleo some subscription fee even if you cancel it on day one. I personally think that is basically dishonest. I prefer not to use products from companies that play games like that.
review.name: OK but lots of monthly bills

review.reviewBody: This little device is MEGA!!! Easy to setup and allows you to stay connected with family and friends in the backcountry. I would highly recommend this device for any one that wants to stay safe and connected in the backcountry.
review.name: Staying Connected

review.reviewBody: I am loving my ZOLEO.  Super easy to set up with my iphone.  Just add the free app and connect the device via bluetooth.  Once set up, you get your dedicated SMS number which you can share with emergency contacts and friends.  The device automatically switches from cellular or wifi to satellite so you never miss messages.  Perfect for hut trips, camping trips, or just traveling.  It gives my wife peace of mind knowing she can always reach me and I can send her check in messages so she knows we are on schedule.  Just a great device and the dark sky weather app is a great perk.
review.name: Great Communication in the backcountry

review.reviewBody:
I love my ZOLEO.   I find it is very easy to pair with my phone and send text messages or short e-mails.  The ZOLEO has a unique feature that it tries to send messages using cellular or wi-fi before using the Iridium satellite network.  This saves you money!  

ZOLEO supports check-in and SOS alerting via the built-in buttons so even if your phone is out of battery power.  Key point as my phone seems to die often.  Battery life is 200 hours and it charges in 2 hours.   Seems to hold a charge well and I have had no issues with it.  

The outer case is tough and has a rubberized finish that is water, dust and shockproof.  Good to know as I keep it attached to the outside of my pack.
review.name: Works awesome - seamless app

name: Satellite Communicator

review.reviewBody: I've worn the carbide bib pants snowshoeing in sticky wet above freezing temperature snow and frigid dry 20 degree snow and they've been great. Being able to comfortably go without a bottom layer in warmer snow and adding wool long johns on the freezing days makes them so versatile. Plus they are incredibly comfortable. I resisted using bib-style forever having always used snowboard style pant but now that I've used these I donated all my snowboard pants. That extra little layer going up the back made the days so comfortable - no slow loss of body heat during the day. Cannot say enough.
review.name: Best ever!

You know..., every now and then, things go sideways; unglug it and plug it back in usually does the trick.

review.itemreviewed: Zephyr GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have had these boots going on a month now. I wear them for work where I walk 6 to 8 miles in them. I needed about 2 weeks of breaking them in to became like slippers. They are very supportive and very comfortable. The sole is grippy and I get compliments on the way it looks. I wear these for work everyday. These boot have a PU midsole that I hear deteriorates is not used so you need to use them often. These are not able to be resoled like some of Lowa's higher end boots.
review.name: Awesome boot for the price.

review.itemreviewed: Zephyr GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The PU (polyurethane) midsole deteriorates over time, even when kept in a climate controlled shoe closet. Lowa refused to replace it and told me they knew this will happen. In fact they said that their warranty specifically refuses to cover this. (They blamed me for not wearing it more (?). I use my boats several times a year on hiking trips - but expect such an expensive shoe to last longer. I will stick with EVA midsoles in the future.
review.name: Midsole deteriorates quickly

name: Zephyr GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: I’ve never written a clothing review but was super disappointed. Although there is a lining, the fabric comes up high around neck so I find it scratchy & uncomfortable b/c it’s not a soft fleece at all. The fit is so boxy and arms so excessively bulky and extra long that I was laughing out loud when I tried it on. Cheap feeling fabric, clown-like fit.
review.name: Scratchy and bulky yuck

review.reviewBody: I was drawn to the design, got it in the black and green. The fit is boxy, wish it was longer and more form fitting. The quality is good, a bit rougher for a faux shearlingI was debating in returning but kept it since I got it on sale.
review.name: Cool print. Boxy cut

review.reviewBody: Love the print but the lining feels very stiff and cheap. It’s really hard to take off once you have it on.
review.name: Looks cute but..

review.reviewBody: Keeps me warm and the designs are so cute! Perfect winter fit. 10/10
review.name: So comfy

review.reviewBody: I've been loving this pullover! It fits cropped and boxy on me, and has a drawcord adjustment at the bottom . I use this to cinch the hem and have the pullover maintain the boxy shape. I think the fleece is quite soft and comfortable. The high collar is fleece on both sides for extra comfort and warmth around my neck. One thing to note is that the lining does not stretch, which can make getting it on and off a little challenging, but I think the lining stops wind from coming through since this really keeps me warm. I sized up so I have a little more room for layers underneath. So cute and I may have to get the other color!
review.name: Cute and Warm

review.reviewBody: Agree with the other reviewer - the material honestly feels icky, and the shape is very odd and uncomfortable. Too much fabric in the arms and body so you can’t move your arms easily, but the opening at the waist isn’t wide enough for a loose boxy look and is challenging to get on and off!
review.name: Cheap and lumpy

review.reviewBody: I have actually never written a clothing review before - but this made me extremely sad :( the design of this fleece is very cool but I knew it was very cheaply made before I even got as far as putting it on. Thankfully I got it on sale (or else I’d be crying) but I can’t believe they would normally charge $139 for the worst quality fleece hoodie I’ve ever encountered. Had very high hopes but won’t waste my money on this brand again.
review.name: Very cheaply made

name: Printed Fleece 1/4-Zip Pullover - Women's

review.reviewBody: This is lightweight, cozy on the inside but breathes well. Great for an early morning or light weight layer.
review.name: AirMesh

review.reviewBody: Just bought my second one…I’ve worn this one hiking, downhill and XC skiing. Even walking the dog on cold New Hampshire days and evenings. It’s super light, I’ve brought it on a backpacking trip last summer too. Very versitile, light as air, warm!
review.name: Love love love!

review.reviewBody:
I love this airmesh shirt, so lightweight but warm.  However,  I needed to exchange for a different size.  I used the chat function to assist me.  The shirt on sale was about $28.  I had to pay $5.95 shipping for the first shirt, and shockingly another $5.95 fir the exchange size!  Almost $12 shipping for a lightweight $28 shirt!
Come on Backcountry!  You can do better!  No wonder Amazon has such a booming business!
I feel I was ripped off!
review.name: Love shirt but not customer service

review.reviewBody: This is the warmest shirt I've ever put on. The second I put it on I immediately felt warmer, even though I can see light through the mesh! Love the color and the fit is perfect. I have wide shoulders and large upper arms and often have to size up in tops but the small is just right. I don't expect it to survive too too long as it seems fairly delicate, I'm sure I'll snag it on something quickly haha. Definitely going to be hand wash only and never in the dryer. That's just the nature of these specialized materials though so I'm going to purchase another one right now just in case. The small weighs 94 grams btw.
review.name: Incredible warmth for weight

review.reviewBody: Perfect for chilly morning runs! the material is so soft and cozy, but also very breathable and moisture-wicking. My only complaint is that it is not super flattering but worth it for the comfort.
review.name: Great cold weather running shirt!

review.reviewBody: This is a nice top with several problems.  Its SUPER warm.  Like wearing a coat, which was a surprise.  For some unfortunate reason Mtn Hardware is in 'the short center back length phase' because it needs to be several inches longer.  I say that because it wants to ride up when wearing it.  The first time I wore it it was under a light jacket to do some hiking and I had to keep pulling it down because it was rising up to my chest.  It was pretty uncomfortable and looked ridiculous.   It might have helped if I had a tshirt on under it but its so hot I cant imagine wearing it with anything else.  So I tucked it in my leggings and then it held unless it pulled out from movement.  Not sure how to fix this problem but it would keep me from buying another one.  Please fix this shirt.  It is a good idea but it needs help
review.name: needs retooling

review.reviewBody: Love the AirMesh products. Already owned the hooded version of this and love it.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: The breathable mesh and light weight material is very unique, but keeps you very warm.  The size a bigger than listed.
review.name: Unique warm material

review.reviewBody: Mountain Hardware: Please make more of this wonderful top in new colors!   I got this on the hope it might be good as a lightweight hiking/backpacking piece.  I got one in light gray before that color sold out.  It is light as a feather.  Next I worried it would snag in five seconds but I've worn it frequently, including while hiking with my backpack on, while cooking, or sleeping in my sleeping bag.  No snags so far.   Next I worried it wouldn't breathe because when you first put it on it feels instantaneously warm.  But it can breathe.  In fact the wind can get right into it.  I usually wear a t-shirt under it, which helps block wind.  Overall I am thrilled because it's a big warmth payout for very little weight and bulk in my backpack.  Although it is thin, it has loft to it to looks nice.  It is not clingy.  Fit is excellent.  I would like more color options, warm tones, earth tones, variety of colors.  I might consider buying it in hoodie form but I don't like the zipper option so probably this long sleeve shirt is ideal for good coverage without excess weight or fabric.  It is very important to find highly functional clothing for mountain terrain.
review.name: Amazing addition to my backpacking gear

review.reviewBody: Wore it for a night run, 45 degrees and windy. Wore a windbreaker on top of it. The wind died down and I had to remove the windbreaker and push the sleeves of the Airmesh top to my elbows because I was too warm. Once I stopped running, it kept me comfortable. 2 dislikes, I normally wear a small, bought XS, it's still not. It's not form fitting, and the sleeves are too long for me (sleeves are always too long for me, but the thumb holes style make this even longer if I'm not using the thumb holes.) I like the slate blue color, but I really wish they had it in yellow in XS! (The hoodie XS was sold out.)
review.name: Thin but amazingly warm.

name: AirMesh Long-Sleeve Crew Top - Women's

review.reviewBody: I'm finding myself really gravitating to the Sweet Protection apparel and equipment. I recently received a pair of these Hunter II Light shorts after being really happy with their helmets and glasses, and the shorts join the ranks of my favorite shorts. I think what sets these apart is the feel of the fabric. Super sleek and lightweight and they feel great to ride in. I wore these the first time on a particularly hot day and was impressed with the airflow, but protection they provided. Highly recommend these for your next pair of shorts! I like how simple the design is as well.
review.name: Best Fabric for MTB Shorts

name: Hunter II Light Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: Good things about these pants 1- These pants are nice and warm 2- Fabric is durable and comfortable (it takes a few wears/washes) 3- The pants aren't see through, but I did get a dark color why I dont love these pants 1- the fabric isn't very flexible. While possible, these pants make it hard to get full ROM at the knees 2- the waist sits low and likes to ride down. This adds to the difficulty of bending my knees, I feel like I have to pull these pants up every time I squat or sit down. 3- the seam near the ankle digs in like crazy with ski boots. It only took one run to notice the rubbing and the seam was painful by the end of the day. 4- length. I'm 5'10 and these pants fall a couple inches about my ankle. But for most people I'd imagine the length is just fine 5'10 athletic build ordered size M
review.name: works for casual activities

review.reviewBody: I wore these under my Cirque 2 pants for cross country skiing. They were a good base layer for temperatures hovering around 0C .
review.name: A good base layer

review.reviewBody: Got this for my wife and she had to return it because the material doesn't feel very nice against the skin and rides up. There are better merino base layer bottoms on the market.
review.name: Doesn't feel good

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and cozy. Great for lounging around the house and also for layering for hiking, camping and skiing. Go to layer for leight weight warmth. Love the color too!
review.name: Great color. Comfortable and cozy.

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love these pants so much! They aren't stretchy, but I feel like functional movement in the legs is fine. The waistband is way too loose and they fall off my body. Unfortunately, I won't be able to wear them on a snowboard trip to Japan as I can't spend my whole day trying to keep them from falling down. Maybe I can take in the waist myself?
review.name: Wrong fit - cannot recommend based on fit

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love these, but I can't believe how unstretchy they are! I was going to use them for activities like under pants for climbing or hiking when cold, but there's no way these would feel good for that. They restricted movement too much.
review.name: Very unstretchy

review.reviewBody: The bottoms are super comfy, fit well and seem like they are durable. The bottoms were a little scratchy right out of the package, but are much softer after a wash.
review.name: Light, strong and soft.

review.reviewBody: I used these under windproof shells to run the North Pole marathon in summer 2023. The temps were upper 20s with light wind and sunny. These provided just enough insulation without being too hot. I recommend these for any active outdoor activity under a windproof/waterproof shell.
review.name: I took these to the North Pole and worked great

review.reviewBody: Super lightweight base layer, you never felt bulky! Bought the set in snow camo too! They kept me warm.
review.name: Perfect for layering!

review.reviewBody: Very soft and comfortable, fits well. Use this for active outdoor activities in cool/cold temperatures.
review.name: Yes

name: Alpine Onset Bottom - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The waterproof boots are very well made. But, the shoe is made too narrow on the inside and I cannot easily get my foot in the shoes.
review.name: Too hard to get feet inside the shoe.

review.itemreviewed: Chilkat V Zip WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable boots. True to size, but you might want to go up a half size to accommodate thick socks as I did. They are not difficult to get on when using the provided webbing loops. Fast on-fast off with the side zipper feature. Very happy with these boots.
review.name: Perfect Mid-rise Muck Boot

review.itemreviewed: Chilkat V Zip WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I've had these boots for about a month and have worn them at least 20 days.  I primarily used them for shoveling snow and plowing.   The first problem is as others noted; the zippers keep coming down.  This results in snow getting inside the boot - very poor design.

I then used them to go back country hiking in the snow.    As the snow was deep enough to cover familiar trails, there was some off-trail hiking.  Upon returning to my house I noticed that the toe of my left boot was sliced open, and insulating material was coming out.  I communicated with Backcountry.com, and since it is not a "workmanship defect" they will not warranty or replace the boot.

So...   These boots are not meant for "back country" use, nor would they be acceptable on the "north face" of any slope.    Unless you are buying "snow boots" to use in snow less than 4 inches, and walk exclusively on paved surfaces, I cannot recommend these.
review.name: poor quality / poor design

review.itemreviewed: Chilkat V Zip WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased these boots after a similarly constructed pull-on North Face boot I own split at the seam between the leather upper and the plastic bottom. I really liked the previous pair of North Face boots, so naturally wanted to replace them. This new boot is well constructed with nice quality materials. I read that they run small, so I ordered a half size larger than my previous and similar North Face boot. They fit very well, but the boot is unusually difficult to get on. I cant imagine wanting to go through that every time I put the boots on. Once on, the zippers wont stay up, they unzip themselves after about 15 minutes of being outside. Also, the boot has a hard unpadded upper edge that cuts into my lower leg at the top of the boot. Pretty uncomfortable after a couple hours of wear. Sorry to say I am disappointed and will be returning these.
review.name: Nice boots in store but not so nice in field

review.itemreviewed: Chilkat V Zip WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these boots after a similarly constructed pull-on North Face boot I own split at the seam between the leather upper and the plastic bottom.  I really liked the previous pair of North Face boots, so naturally wanted to replace them.  This new boot is well constructed with nice quality materials.  I read that they run small, so I ordered a half size larger than my previous and similar North Face boot.  They fit very well, but the boot is unusually difficult to get on. I cant imagine wanting to go through that every time I put the boots on.  Once on, the zippers wont stay up, they unzip themselves after about 15 minutes of being outside. Also, the boot has a hard unpadded upper edge that cuts into my lower leg at the top of the boot.  Pretty uncomfortable after a couple hours of wear.  Sorry to say I am disappointed and will be returning these.
review.name: Nice boots in store, but so nice infield

review.itemreviewed: Chilkat V Zip WP Boot - Men's

review.name: Never

review.reviewBody: So soft and supportive. I prefer a M to a small so I have some more breathing room for yoga (32c/34b)
review.name: Fave bra

review.reviewBody:
Hi there-

I wanted to love the racer back bra but I couldn’t! The fabric is fantastic however it is too small. Can I return them for a different type of bra? I actually wore one to a Pilates class and it didn’t work out!
On the other hand I live the pants. The material is so soft! Thank you.
review.name: Bra and bottoms

review.reviewBody: This bra is absolutely terrible. I really regret taking the tags off because now I can’t return it. And it was pricy too. It’s so tight and uncomfortable. I did the size chart and everything. I really hope it stretches out over time because right now it’s almost unbearable to wear. I’m gonna try and make the most of it but yeah I don’t think I’ll ever buy from this company again :/
review.name: Not worth it

review.reviewBody: The fabric is the absolute softest and most comfortable out there in my opinion. I do wish there was a little shelf bra inside there for a little added support.

review.reviewBody: Great white color, great soft fabric, flattering cut. Offers good support in workouts. Highly recommend.
review.name: Soft and cute.

review.reviewBody: The fit is perfect. Some bras in a small or not sized right and are too restricting and the fabric is so soft. It’s the most comfortable sports bra I have I have 5 of them in different colors.

review.reviewBody: This bra just isn't for me. I'll wear it to hang out at home, but that's it. I am a 36D for reference. The straps felt uncomfortable on my shoulders and around my neck after a few hours, and I had to keep pulling the bra up in front. If I went a size up, it would be too big, and a size down would be way too small. The straps felt too long, and the bra felt a tad small. Adjustable straps might help, but I'm not sure. The overall fit was just off which is a bummer. Otherwise the material felt great and the quality was as expected from other BY purchases.
review.name: Nice bra but did not work for me

review.reviewBody: Was small on me though I have a big rib cage and didn't have support I needed.
review.name: Lightweight bra

review.reviewBody: I did not expect the quality to be this good. It is very well made, not see through and super supportive.
review.name: Thick material and supportive!

review.reviewBody: This is a great tent….IF you camp when it isn’t raining. I’m basically echoing what a lot of others have said unfortunately. The good is that it goes up easily (even for one person) and there’s enough room for my husband and I. However, the one night we took it out and it rained it was horrible. It didn’t even rain that much…a VERY tiny cell of rain. We woke up to lots of wetness having leaked through the head end where the cut out in the fly was. Pretty disappointed honestly. It’s such an expensive tent and I expected a lot more! So now we have to look into a new tent bc this one can’t be used in last minute rainy situations imo.
review.name: Good unless it rains

review.reviewBody: Finally got to use this tent this last weekend and I couldn’t get over the design of this thing. Not just the overall tent but the features it has from the clips, to the poles, to the interior pockets. Everything had been throughly thought through during the design of this tent. Now I have the previous model “dragonfly 2” (not osmos) only difference being the fabric used I believe. Which if I had one thing to point out about the tent is the fabric on the floor is definitely thin, there’s no way I’d feel comfortable using without a foot print. I’m curious if the “osmo” has a stronger floor than my previous model. I think I’m a Nemo customer for life though, after realizing the quality of this I now want see if Nemo makes as good of a sleeping pad as they do a tent. The tensor all season seems to have awesome reviews as well.
review.name: Well thought out design features

review.reviewBody:
I have owned this tent for over 5 years.  It has thousands of kilometers of travel on bicycles, in kayaks and motorcycle adventure touring.  It has been setup from mountain tops to Death Valley, and in weather ranging from torrid rain to desert heat. This is an excellent tent.

The tent is really bomb proof.  It repels water very well while maintaining its light weight packability.  The dual vestibules provide easy access from either side and tons of storage space for packs, panniers, or other gear you want out of view or out of the weather.  The air flow is really good too.  The fly can be off, partially open, or fully open to the zippered doors.  The new OSMO fabric version has improved the fly flap hold-back, making it easier to secure and release (especially in the dark).  

The inside of the tent provides plenty of room to move about.  It also has good storage pockets for your stuff, a nice loft in the top of the tent and a couple neat little light-diffusing holders above the head area that allows to tuck your head-light into them and light up the whole tent.

The Dragonfly has lots of options to secure it down (helpful in strong winds or to keep the tent a fly tight in rain events).  There is no better tent peg than NEMO peg.  I have pounded a lot tent pegs and these are simply the best!

I will provide a couple of comments that might be helpful to either the person considering the tent and for NEMO.  First, I would suggest the optional footprint for the tent.  While never an absolute requirement the footprint does provide just a little added protection for the floor of the tent.  Second, the buyer will have to acquire a couple more tent pegs if they want to use all the securing guy line tie-downs.  The third consideration is NEMO's Warranty.  I had an issue with my first tent and they fully stood behind their product - absolutely without question.  And finally, a comment to NEMO.  The foot-end fly guy line is affixed to the fly at a point up the ridge pole.  While this helps secure the structure of the tent it does not provide any relief of the fly from the base of the tent.  So, with or without this guy line secured rain runs down the fly and onto the tent body rather than being directed away from the tent itself.  Moving the attachment to the bottom edge of the fly would fix this.

All in all I have never owned a better 2-person tent (including Moss, MSR, Mountain Equipment Coop, Kelty).  Well done NEMO!!
review.name: No better tent!

review.reviewBody: Super light good waterproofing decent space for the size.
review.name: Awesome Tent!

review.reviewBody: Bought their dragonfly and was not disappointed. I bought the 2P so i could have ample room and i did. 6’2” and 280. More than enough room for gear for me and the dog.
review.name: Nemo continues to deliver

review.reviewBody: This tent is super light and packs down very small. Purchased for backpacking and long canoe trips. Love the asymmetrical design for more headroom and the clip together pole setup was super easy. Can’t wait to take it into the backcountry!
review.name: Super lightweight and packable

review.reviewBody:
Bought this to fill my desire for an ultra light weight tent. It has filled this role well. It’s certainly light but the tent has other virtues as well. Easy set up, awesome fly, and keeps me dry! My only concern is the durability of such a light weight tent. Obviously it will not be as durable as a heavier tent but it’s something I think about. Overall, this tent is everything 
I was looking for in this category. The two tone mesh took a bit of getting used to but it’s a nice but not needed addition. I’ll be using it quite a bit this year so an updated review in a few months will be forth coming.
review.name: Great features

review.reviewBody:
I believe this particular tent is advertised as a backpacking tent. NEMO makes lighter tents for that. 
I’ve put this tent thru the ringer quite a few times and it’s never failed me. This is my go to tent, for when out and about on my own. Either hunting or out fishing for a few days. It’s not only easy to set up, it withstands whatever you throw at it. It’s been covered in snow and it still kept me dry. I would say that the only con I have, is the head room. You won’t be able to stand up, but depending on your height, you can easily move around while on your knees. I absolutely love this tent. My wife is usually a bit picky, but we took this out for an overnight trip not long ago, and she loved it. 
3 of us have slept in it, 2 adults and my 16 year old daughter and their was plenty of space for us. Our packs stayed in the truck, and probably wouldn’t fit inside with 3 people. But most of the time it’s just me and my Golden Lab. Although this tent isn’t cheap, it’s also not super expensive. You won’t regret buying this tent and I would absolutely recommend it.
review.name: Not for backpacking.

review.reviewBody: I bought this tent just over a month ago and love it! I have used it 20+ days in the field and am quite impressed with it. I worked a course in the Northen San Rafael Swell in UT. and the tent held up through 50+mph winds. I appreciate the water repelancy and lack of stretch that this tent has as well. Lastly, I really appreciate the spacious head room that it has. I love this tent and have even talked a coworker into getting a NEMO tent.
review.name: Spacious and Durable tent!

review.reviewBody: Purchased to replace a backpacking tent and to use for bikepacking. So far has been amazing for backpacking, paddle trips and bikepacking. The small packed size and roomy interior makes it ideal for my pup, partner and I. My only concern is the durability of the very light screen and tent fabric. BUT I have faith, NEMO products have been a trusted companion in the outdoors for many years.
review.name: Great packed size and versatility!

name: Dragonfly OSMO Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: lighter and more ergonomic than what I've had in the past or at my local wall. Seems a bit dainty at first, but took a few whippers with it and loving it!
review.name: lighter and more ergonomic than

review.reviewBody: I have been climbing with this harness at the gym. It felt very good. It is light weight but still feels secure. And it looks super good! I love it
review.name: Best gym harness ever!

review.reviewBody: Fit is excellent. Wore a Petzl Sitka for years, before that, the Hirundos. The BDEL Zone fit, rise and load is a direct feel, as many climbers will recognize, that's the main factor. The comfort on it is stellar, it moves well, takes a 40m route's worth of draws and loads it comfortably on your waist. The leg loops fit like they ought to for sport climbers, vs some harness leg loops that are designed for larger leg groups. It's my go to harness for sure.
review.name: Zone Harness

review.reviewBody: I really enjoy it so dar. Its a great fit and the material feels nice. I have used it for top rope only and am excited to try lead climbing in it.
review.name: Zone Harness

review.reviewBody:
Feels like I'm not even wearing a harness.

The infinity loop is a nice bonus.
review.name: ergonomic & svelte

review.reviewBody: Ice, rock, indoors or outside, this harness is comfortable in whatever setting you’re into. Fit is great, comfortable, gear loops for days. Support is phenomenal.
review.name: Fits the bill

review.reviewBody: Great product. It’s light with 5 gear loops. I have used the harness a several multi-pitch routes with no complaints.
review.name: Great harness

review.reviewBody: It’s comfortable and have the loops for the ice screw holders.
review.name: Great harness.

review.reviewBody: With the caveat that I’ve only used this harness once so far and owned a BD Solution harness for about five years, this felt slightly less comfortable overall and seems to fit slightly on the smaller side as well. I found the wider legs loops on the Solution to be more supportive while hanging and lowering, while I didn’t actually notice the reduced weight the Zone’s narrower design supposedly affords. The infinity belay loops and extra gear loops are definitely pluses though. I’m about120lb/5’7” and got a size small. The waist fits well, but the leg loops are a bit snug. I wore the same size in the Solution without an issue. I’m a woman, but generally prefer the men’s style harness because of the narrower leg loops and lower rise.
review.name: Nice overall but the solution is more comfortable

review.reviewBody: Solid wish the legs were adjustable but it’s 100% awesome either way
review.name: Solid wish the legs were

name: Zone Harness

review.reviewBody: Purchased for my son. He loves the size and design. Very rugged build. Should last a long time!
review.name: Great chalk pot

review.reviewBody:
Nothing too fancy but perefctly practical. 
Even this smaller version fits both my hands (on the bigger side) comfortably to chalk up and not make a mess. 
Zipper pocket fits tape and sanding block or snacks but no phone.
Brush holder was giving me trouble with my brush. I'm sure it would fit the thinner "toothbrush" looking brushes with the thinner stems but it wouldn't take my normal sized bouldering brush. 
No magnet on opening. 
All in all, a perfectly functional bouldering bag for the ways I'll be using it. (I identify more as a roped climber than as a pad slammer)
If otherwise, I'd go for the bigger bag with the magnet closure and stitch in a better brush holster. 
One Love
review.name: Does what it's supposed to.

review.reviewBody: Was tired of my chalk bag falling over at the gym, but did not want a HIGE bucket. This is the perfect solution!
review.name: perfect

review.reviewBody: Super convenient, the zipped pouch is the perfect size for a roll of climbing tape and a small brush
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: What you get for such a low price is great. Only thing that is slightly annoying is that there is no magnetic closure, which could be nice. But no spills so far, and I’ve had it for while!
review.name: Amazing Chalk Bag

review.reviewBody: It’s better than just having my regular chalk bag while bouldering. This can’t get lost under a crash pad and get kicked over by other climbers. Also, great for the little ones while out climbing, they don’t just sling chalk every where. 😂
review.name: Awesome!

review.reviewBody: Terrific chalk pot—big enough to stick my hands in, but not so enormous that it's tedious to carry around all the time. Plus, super cute colours!
review.name: Love this!

review.reviewBody: I bought this more than a month ago and hasn't been delivered
review.name: Not delivered
comment: I’m really sorry to hear that you haven’t received your order after a month. I’ve emailed you to discuss how we can help resolve this shipping issue for you.

review.reviewBody: Great size. I use it as a ditty bag for all kinds of stuff. Good structure and sits nice and flat on the ground.

review.reviewBody: I only recently got into bouldering after years of being too scared without a top rope. This is the perfect mini chalk bucket for indoor bouldering and is not too bulky! Love the Mondito. Maybe one day I’ll purchase the Mondo but this one is fantastic.
review.name: Perfect for a new boulderer!

hasVariant.name: Aircontact Core SL 60+10L Backpack - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Deuter Aircontact Core SL 60+10L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This backpack is made with quality. It goes around waist so that it keeps it it place while hiking. It has a ton of pockets to hold everything you’d want or need for a hike. The back it made so that you can keep good posture while walking without hurting your back.
review.name: Roomy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am really loving this backpack and all of the features that it has. I am a mom of multiple children and we do day hikes as well as overnight hikes. The biggest issue that I have with backpacks is being able to easily get things out of it throughout our hike without having to unpack everything. My favorite thing about this one is that there is a large zipper in the very front of the bag that allows me to open up the backpack almost as a door to get items. With this access point I am able to get items that are at the very bottom or the very top without having to take much extra out. This is especially great at lunchtime, I’m able to get everything I need out without having to do too much unpacking and repacking.  This has been a true game changer for us and I have not had that in any other packs. There are two fanny pack style compartments (hip belt pockets) that are located on the hip belt that I also use frequently for smaller frequently used items. The fit of this backpack is very comfortable and allows me to easily distribute the weight of the contents in the bag. This color is also nice as it does not show the dirt as easily as some of the light colors. The material feels and has been very durable and has a high quality look and functional feel to it! Overall I am very happy with this bag and would recommend for any skill level of hiker looking for a large capacity carrying bag!
review.name: I love this backpack and all of the features.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great back pack. I’ve used it twice. I’m carrying about 20 lbs without my water. Lots of room and adjustable depending on your height so if you are short like me, not an issue. Very comfortable. Love it so much
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag holds a lot and has many nifty pockets and features. Although advertised for women, the adjustable height works for teens. Good air flow and light materials. The straps could be more comfortable. They are lacking some padding, especially when the bag is packed full. Overall, nice quality for backpacking.
review.name: Aircontact Core 60+10SL

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Aircontact Core 60+10 SL is of exceptional quality.  I’m so impressed of the thoughtfulness of details and design.  From the curves on the shoulder and hip straps to the various attachment loops- so amazing.  It’s lightweight, comfortable, and durable.  By far the best pack I have owned.
review.name: No detail spared!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this new back. 1st the color is so nice. This bag is very large. It fits all of my hiking necessities and then some. The fit is great and it is very comfortable. It is greatly made and I'm sure will last a long time.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The first look at it it’s a huge happiness! The quality is out of this world and it has a very big size that i’m pretty sure if fits everything what a family needs! Super useful and essential! The best of the world!
review.name: Super quality!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this for my husband and he loves it. He wants to start hiking and often does a lot of walking in the woods when he goes fishing and hunting. While I’m not sure he will use it for fishing and hunting, he will definitely be thrilled to have it for hiking. It has tons of storage space and is pretty large. I wish it had some bright “ here I am” colors on it just for safety but that is on my husband not the company because he picked this himself. All around it’s a really nice pack and has tons of pockets, a waist clip and I believe it’s steel supports along the back of it.
review.name: Very nice

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Got this couple weeks ago and finally got to use it this past weekend one our 15 mile hike thru the canyons and wow! I’m glad I scooped up this backpack! Super comfortable, the extra back support came in handy. Zippers are super easy to access without taking it off. Perfect size to fit all the right gear and essentials! I personally thought the bag was pretty light for its size! I would 100% recommend this backpack!
review.name: Built for comfort!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is an excellent backpack! It can be used to go on a backpacking trip like traveling through Europe or Asia. It can also be used for a backpacking hiking trip. It is well designed to provide a good amount of support to the back and be as comfortable as possible. It looks stylish and the dark color is cool. Lots of compartments to pack everything you need. Definitely recommend
review.name: Great hiking backpack!

name: Aircontact Core SL 60+10L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: Fits true to size. Beautiful color. I use it for playing beach volleyball in the winter. Keeps me warm and isn't bulky. I get compliments on it every time I've worn it. I love telling them about this brand.
review.name: Winter Vest

review.reviewBody: Love the color combo and how it is light weight and not very puffy.
review.name: Love the color combo and

review.reviewBody: I love this vest in hot pink and orange! It's not only cute but also keeps me warm!!!
review.name: great product

review.reviewBody: Bought matching vests for the whole family and they were a hit! All sizes fit true to size and are great quality. Never disappointed with Cotopaxi products!
review.name: Great vest!!

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a gift for my sister. Looking forward to Christmas!
review.name: Perfect Christmas gift!

review.reviewBody:
I love the color and weight of this vest -- light but warm and good for layering. I also like the way I can wear it with a dress or jeans, when I need warmth or more pockets. I deducted one star for the narrow cut around the bottom. I am short waisted, and it comes down over my hips, and I have to wear close-fitting leggings to zip it up. Impossible for jeans or a skirt. A larger size would be too big across the shoulders.
I am 5 feet tall, 100 pounds and got the xxs.
review.name: Nice weight, snug on hips

review.reviewBody: Went by sizing chart told me to get 1x , I normally wear large to X-Large tops . By sizing cm -I followed it exactly did not size up even thinking of sweatshirt , the vest was ridiculously big. It was like a dress , way way too long . It would be nice to have options for petite short torso people . My 6’1 bf tried it and it went 4 inches past his waist. The website needs to list dimensions please. Otherwise the material felt nice , thin, compact could travel well. But didn’t get to try since returning for size
review.name: Too big

review.reviewBody: I ordered a vest that was too big for me. I returned it for smaller size. Super easy and quick!
review.name: Great Vest and easy return

review.reviewBody: The vest is so light but keeps you warm. I also bought their jacket and it’s so nice!
review.name: Great vest

review.reviewBody: This vest is cute, comfortable, and wears well with almost any outfit. It fits true to size and I love the colors.
review.name: Buy this vest!

review.reviewBody: This is one of the best outdoor button downs I have ever worn.  It's very cool and nice touch on my skin. I need one of these shirts for each day of the week
review.name: One comfortable shirt

review.reviewBody:
I've really enjoyed mountain biking in button up jerseys lately and this one is my favorite.  I do size down, actually.  I normally wear a medium but I want my jersey kinda fitted so I go with a small.  I'm 5'11" and about 175lbs.  

The shirt is comfy, super light weight, and the airflow through the buttons is fantastic.  I have two, and I'll buy more when they're on sale again.
review.name: Perfect Riding Shirt

review.reviewBody:
I like the material stretch and this feels super light and breezy going down hill.

I honestly don't know what I can put in the pocket without making it unbalanced, maybe a twenty spot?

I'm a narrow guy that normally wears a M t-shirt or button up, and although this sits on my shoulders well the sleeves and trunk seem like they've got a lot of extra room.

Wish they had a better color selection.
review.name: Seems a bit large for a medium

review.reviewBody: I’m very happy with everything about this shirt. It’s nice enough looking that I don’t need to change when I get to the office. I don’t think any of my coworkers even know it’s a cycling jersey.
review.name: Great shirt for commuting

review.reviewBody: Bought a few weeks ago to use for early winter trail riding. They are well made but the pair of XLs I have are way too small. I simply cannot use the liners inside the outer glove. The outer by itself is ok to just below freezing but anything below that they are useless.
review.name: Too Small!

review.reviewBody: Good for dry cool conditions but no where near waterproof. Pretty much squeezed hand and had water drip out from being in a wet heavy snow.
review.name: Not waterproof one bit

review.reviewBody: They are warm and nearly water/snow proof when doing nearly any activity. If not moving hands do get cold. As in previous reviews they do fit small. I am normally a large, but ordered an extra large and lucky I did as the XL is snug. Putting the glove on with the liner inserted is hard. Way easier to pull the liner out, put that on and then put the shell over.
review.name: They are good but not great.

review.reviewBody: The gloves passed the wet snow test without problem. Good value for money purchase!
review.name: Confortable and warm

review.reviewBody: The gloves fit nicely and are true to size.  They work perfect for snowboarding.  Not overly expensive but well built.
review.name: Perfect for Snowboarding

review.reviewBody: I purchased these gloves for skiing. The fit and construction are good but the warmth is not. My fingers got cold quickly skiing in 25 degree temps. I had to use Smartwool liners to make these usable which is not ideal due to the added bulk and lost dexterity.
review.name: Not warm enough

review.reviewBody: I've taken these on two military field exercises now in temps ranging between 15-40 F and have been happy with them. The outer gloves stayed dry when it rained and my hands stayed warm when I was stationary for about 6 hours straight in 25 F temps. The biggest thing I would change from these gloves is the liners. The ones that came with the gloves were kind of an awkward fit and they didn't shed sweat very well so I paired the outer glove with the OR 2020 merino wool liners. This combo worked great and I don't feel like hardly any warmth was sacrificed. the pieces of Velcro that connect to the outer glove to the liner it comes with weren't really missed. I'd recommend OR pair the merino wool liners with this glove. It may increase the price but I think it would be a better product.
review.name: Good outer gloves - would change the liners

review.reviewBody: If the temperature is very low, you should tighten the gloves on your wrist and arm and keep moving. After 5 minutes my fingers are no longer frozen
review.name: good

review.reviewBody: These gloves are comfortable and perfect for skiing.
review.name: Perfect for cold weather

review.reviewBody: Used for skiing, plenty warm, size seemed to be a bit small overall, a great glove
review.name: Yes

name: Adrenaline Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: Decent backpack with a few quirks. Positives are the bottom has a coating for durability, the side water bottle pockets are also a durable material rather than mesh, and there's a way to organize all of your essentials for school, work, or hiking. Great for any function. Some cons are that there's no way to replace the bungee system when it wears out, there's no way to secure a water bottle from sliding out the top of the pocket (I just tied some rubber bands on the bag to deal with this), and the website describes a "quick draw access for smartphone" on one of the water bottle pockets, but I've yet to figure out what this means even after talking to customer support.
review.name: Great multi-purpose, missing some features for perfection

review.reviewBody: For my kids school. This is a second one and the best backpack bought
review.name: For my kids school. This is a second one and the best backpa

review.reviewBody: Great backpack so far. Very comfortable on the back, rips top construction seems pretty durable. Lots of space for its size
review.name: Great backpack

review.reviewBody: My daughter uses it for school to keep her supplies in. It's heavy duty. Great material.
review.name: I would buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: Excellent basic backpack. Covers all the essentials.
review.name: A++

review.reviewBody: Love this pack ! Has plenty of storage , great for travel or going on a hike ! Love the shock absorbing straps so they dont dig into the shoulders , great product
review.name: I would recommend this product

review.reviewBody: Son uses this for high school and packs it full. So far it's holding up great!
review.name: Great back pack

review.reviewBody: I had to cut this backpack to take out the plastic thar has in the laptop compartment, It was ruining my life
review.name: HORRIBLE

review.reviewBody: I love the backpack. Perfect for commuting. It has 2 side pockets for normal size and bigger water bottles. The sepearate laptop is key and a lot of inside little pockets to keep smaller items organized, plus it is lightweight so great for riding your bike to work.
review.name: Great Backpack for Everyday and More

review.reviewBody: My daughter loves this backpack. She is in highschool and it's a perfect size. Great colors too!
review.name: Perfect backback!

hasVariant.name: Forge Rubber Wading Boot - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Redington Forge Rubber Wading Boot - Men's online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought these boots to replace a pair I already have. My old pair is getting tired and I will need to replace them soon. These are a great fit. I wear a size 11 shoe and these boots are size 11. I wear them with waders. They have lots of room. Also, they are wide, which is what I need.
review.name: Great boots at a good price

review.reviewBody:
I wear a size 9.5 in nike and size 10 in vans consistently. Size 10 in this wading boot fits with stockingfoot waters and mid weight wool socks. 

Went out 3 times with these boots so far and no major complaints other than the 'sticky rubber sole' isn't really that sticky. These boots were actually pretty useless on slick rocks.

Fit and look great though.
review.name: True to Size

review.reviewBody: They feel light but stout and were stable feeling in the water. The grip was pretty good on Colorado river rocks. I usually wear a 10.5 street shoe and the size 11 felt massive but the fit with the neoprene booty of the waders and a medium wool sock feels secure and not sloppy. The rubber surrounding the boot seems durable and the lacing hardware appears to be of good quality.
review.name: Nice boots

review.reviewBody: Could not find the weight of these boots anywhere, including from Redington.  One size 11 weighs 1 lb 9 oz on my kitchen scale. It’s a pretty light boot.
review.name: This boot weighs…

name: Forge Rubber Wading Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: I really like this toque as it's very warm, cozy & comfy. Having the two layers makes all the difference. It also comes down over enough to cover my ears, as a lot of toques don't do this. Also really like the color.
review.name: Cozy Toque

review.reviewBody: Excellent hat! Perfect weight and very warm. Very nice colors, too.
review.name: Very nice winter stocking cap.

review.reviewBody: I live in Minnesota and happen to have quite the beanie collection due to our drastic changes in winter temps. I bought this one for when I'm out with my dogs or shoveling snow in the negative digits. Now only did it keep me warm but it's super soft and fits like a glove and doesn't creep up. It's also quite stylish. I got this on sale but it's worth the full price. A 10!
review.name: Warmest and softest Beanie

review.reviewBody: Love this beanie. Received as a gift and it's great! Insulated and keeps my head and ears warm. Would love it even better if there were more color options!!
review.name: Cute and warm!

review.reviewBody: Bought this for myself, but ended up giving away as a gift. This beanie is AWESOME if you have a huge, ginormous head. If you have a regular sized head or slightly small head this ridiculously large beanie isn't for you. Not sure how this is described as a women's beanie.
review.name: Huge

review.reviewBody: I give this pad five stars because it works and does its job. I’m coming from a 3 inch pad though, so this one is a very thin! I actually put a Z pad underneath it. And decided it might not be worth carrying and if I’m going to use a thin pad I might as well just use the Z pad. I’ll save my thicker, one for colder seasons! I guess I’ll find out what I decide shortly!
review.name: OK pad

review.reviewBody: After less than 4 months the seams are delaminating and letting air out of the mat. I wake up with a stuff, painful back and deflated mat. I am beyond disappointed. This is the second thermarest model which had delaminated for me. I will not give this cowboy company any more of my hard earned cash.
review.name: Disappointing quality

review.reviewBody:
I’ve used my Thermarest pad for several backpacking trips and I am grateful for its cushiness. My bony hips seem fine w sleeping on the ground somehow and I have to give credit to the pad.
When I set up my tent I open the pad valve and go do other things. The pad inflates a tiny but not as much as I had hoped it would. I just blow it up and it doesn’t take that much effort.
I was just now putting my gear away from a recent trip—my pad gets unfolded and I store it in a giant cloth bag I stitched up, behind an armoire—where it waits for the next trip!
review.name: No bony hip pain!

review.reviewBody: It didn’t self inflate like the description read. Sleeping on it felt like no more than a glorified yoga mat. So for the price point I returned it.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I bought this Therm-a-rest for a backcountry trip in Hawaii in January. It was perfect for a small sleeping pad with extra warmth. It fit with my height perfectly (5'5"). I had no problems with the wing-lock valve or the padding. Great product, hope it use it more in the future!
review.name: Perfectly Sized, Perfectly Warm

review.reviewBody: Used this all summer with no issues!! So comfy in all terrains, easy to pack away, warm AF!!
review.name: So great!!!

name: Prolite Plus Sleeping Pad - Women's
Prolite Plus Sleeping Pad - Women's

hasVariant.name: Alsek Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Marmot Alsek Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have an older, more robust version of this jacket (it's probably 10 years old). It has more padding, an outer layer more like a very light wetsuit, and fits more tightly. It's beginning to show its age so I was looking for a replacement. When this Alsek jacket came, it was made of much lighter material and it fit more loosely, and the neck was way too wide. It looked weird, to be honest. Like all Marmot items, it appeared to be well made, but the design changed and it was not really what I was looking for.
review.name: Good jacket not for me

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Well made, comfortable, great fitting jacket. It’s warm and keeps you protected from rain and wind.
review.name: My husband’s favorite jacket

review.reviewBody: The jacket itself was nice but I ended up returning it because the torso is too short.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Superb outer shell. Resistant to snags, remarkably wind and rain resistant, warmer than expected, and I love the longer than usual sleeves. PS - also has an internal vest pocket on the right pectoral.
review.name: Love the jacket

review.reviewBody: A replacement for my beloved older version. Just right for cool winter days in SoCal.
review.name: My favorite jacket has been resurrected, sort of!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Happy to say I have been skiing and living in this jacket for 14 years!  It is an incredible value in terms of price and quality.  It is still windproof.  Thank you Marmot for making such affordable, high quality gear.  I have been using your jackets since 1995.
review.name: 14 years and still going with this jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Overall a very nice jacket. I purchased it to replace a similar Marmot jacket I lost on a trip. My only complaint is that the fit is a bit baggy even though I bought size small.
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody: I've had my aslek about 10 years. It's  the best Christmas gift I've ever gotten.  From 25 to 75, all you need is a tee shirt and this jacket.  It looks nice for dinner and it's durable and washes well so you can work in too. Mostly vice-versa though. Get this for your significant other!
review.name: From 25° to 75°, this is your jacket

review.reviewBody: Great fit and weight for any every day casual jacket.
review.name: Great jacket

hasVariant.description: Buy the Wild Country Friend Cam Set 1, 2, 3 online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've used a bunch of the common brands, and Wild Country continue to be my favorite cams for sizes 1-3. The trigger action is smooth, the head shape fits in placements that some competitors don't, and I love having the extendable sling for those placements that need a bit of extra length but don't need to be completely extended. These have always been super confidence-inspiring on hard routes, and with the expert voice discount it's hard to beat them on price. 10/10, would buy these again for sure.
review.name: Great cams!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wonderful gear, light and easy to use!
review.name: Always fantastic to have friends out climbing!

review.reviewBody:
I bought these at the start of COVID when BD cams were sold out everywhere.  I love the extendable sling, they trigger just as well as all the camelots I've used.  And I'm happy to run them on my rack.  

It's also nice not having to bring quickdraws, just alpine draws and the extendable slings on these and I'm set.

I loved them so much I bought doubles in the Zero friends.  I climb mostly in the Gunks and ADKs.
review.name: Haven't died yet

review.reviewBody: I have an older model of the same shorts in size Large, which I don't fit comfortably into any more. I like the styling and the comfort of these updates ones. However I feel like I'm in between sizes on these and the one thing they are missing is a drawstring. With the weight of a phone and keys in your pockets, and just relying on the thinner elastic waist, there's nothing to hold them up securely if your body weight is fluctuating between periods, etc. If you do have curvy thighs, they do ride up periodically, but not persistently.
review.name: 4.5 Stars

review.reviewBody: Im a female in carpentry and these are my favorite shorts! They don't ride up, the inseam is perfect length & can't see anything up my shorts when I'm on a ladder, the waist band is so stretchy and comfy these are perfect with my heavy tool belt, they keep me so cool on hot days. And they have a sporty yet professional look to them.These shorts are perfect.
review.name: These shorts are a 10/10

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great shoe for cycling with a casual look. OH has always wanted a pair so made a great gift
review.name: Perfect present

review.reviewBody:
Seriously cool, but poor cleat placement.
I am size 46 and have a mm of clearance if using these on my MTB (XT cranks), a couple more mm of on gravel bike (ultegra cranks). The cleats are set to be as wide possible, but ingress for the shoe is in the center of the sole, not offset. Needs a redesign for the sole. Probably good if you are size 43 or smaller. Buyer beware on larger sizes.
Love them for the daycare pickup and drop off, photo of Shimano shoes to show how to set cleats properly.
review.name: Good in small sizes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Girlfriend loves them! Wish y'all had a gift receipt option when checking out. I don't want to get a gift card. Had to show her the different options but they fit her little feet and ALL HER CYCLING GIRLS CLUB want a pair. She can feel the difference in riding from the normal tennis shoes she wears without feeling awkward in cycling shoes.
review.name: Try them, you'll keep them!!!

review.reviewBody: I like using these shoes as a spin instructor they clip into the bike well. However, I do find them a bit narrow and sometimes my pinky toe gets a bit squished.
review.name: These shoes are great for spin class!!

review.reviewBody: Great shoe. Has some hot spots at first but as gets broken in like any other shoe works amazingly
review.name: Great shoe for some great riding.

review.reviewBody: Really like using this shoes when riding my bicycle
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: It's very comfortable and pretty. Unfortunately, I haven't measured my size and need to return it. Usually, I'm 7.5 and should have ordered 1 size down.
review.name: Great choice, it fits big

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fit, styling, very retro. Okay, the product fits very well except. Except the back let's the heal to slide out. That's why it gets a four.
When clipped in the entire sole flexes. Not a bad thing it just does.
Would never have even given these shoes a thought if not for Dustin Klein (Everythings been done) recommending the product. 
Thank him.. but I'll take a discount.
review.name: Awesome classy shoes.

review.reviewBody: Fits well and can be used for cycling and great for work also
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: Looks good. Performs well under casual circumstances but not hardcore riding. Lots of compliments on them.
review.name: Looks and performance.

name: Velosamba Made With Nature 2 Shoe

hasVariant.name: Mythic Ultra 180 Sleeping Bag: 32F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the Rab Mythic Ultra 180 Sleeping Bag: 32F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The order was delivered to the wrong address. Backcountry did not correct the error and did not refund the money.
review.name: wrong address

review.reviewBody: It’s a fantastic sleeping bag. I love it, love the small zipper, instead of a full lenght - it’s means I never end in a situation where the sleeping bag has come apart early in the morning and putting it together wakes me up completely. Too I love the inside collar, that means it can be used in various temperatures and winds. And the material is super nice, a cool feeling to sleep in cutting edge technology. Too the hood is perfect, it has meant I no longer bring a hat for sleeping, which I did before, also during summer. The stuff sack is fitting, and water proof, and it’s nice that it comes with a storage sack. In future I will start not not use the stuff sack to save the down. And even that I used it a lot without liner - it’s fresh still, it’s nice to the skin and warm the minute I get into it, with this bag I don’t need sleeping clothes at least not during summer. Only thing I look forward to is the official temperature rating of the sleeping bag.
review.name: It’s a fantastic sleeping bag.

name: Mythic Ultra 180 Sleeping Bag: 32F Down

hasVariant.name: Cragmont Fleece Trapper Hat
hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Cragmont Fleece Trapper Hat online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got a huge thumbs down from my sister who said I looked like "Cousin Eddie" from National Lampoon Christmas Vacation. I wanted it for protection from sun on ski mountain, it fit well and was warm. But I was told no one would sit with me if I wore it. Maybe a younger person could get away with this look. I thought it was cute but forced to return.
review.name: Cousin Eddie

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfy hat, will definitely come in useful for Winter!
review.name: I'd buy in another color too

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Quality is top-notch. It is a really good trapper hat.
review.name: Very good hat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My new favorite winter hat. I wear 7 and 5/8 size fitted hats and this hat was just a tiny bit too tight for me at first, but I hand stretched it a bit and it fit great. Have been wearing it everyday on my morning and night walks with my dog whether they be hour long hikes through the snowy Connecticut hills or two hour walks around our little beach town. Keeps me nice and warm in the brisk New England winter weather.
review.name: Great hat, love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this hat! Bought one for myself, 67 years old, to wear walking my dog, and one for my 12 year old great niece. We both love it!
review.name: Perfect for outdoor activities

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This trapper's quality is excellent. It's stiff at first, but after broken in, it softens, which makes snapping up the rabbit ears very quick and easy, when on the trail. The price is on target: quality justifies price. It's got a good shape, and I can easily shove it in my pack when I don't need it. Though, as it has white in the fabric, consider buying a hat cleaner or even a sweat and dirt protective spray. All in all, terrific trapper. Too bad this was the only color-cuz I'm the boysenberry [color] grew on me and wouldn't mind sporting it in the field. What's more, the color coal brown would be nice, too.
review.name: Terrific Quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very well made and an excellent hat for folks who have glasses.
review.name: Absolute warmest hat you will own.

review.reviewBody: I received this as a gift from my husband after years of looking for the perfect fit winter hat. The hat size is “universal” one size fits all Large but unlike a majority of other brands that oversize  their hats to fit men and simply change the color to sell it to women this hat truly runs small which is perfect for me as a woman. I normally wear a size small/medium in most hat sizes and this hat is perfect for me so be cautious this hat is not a true Large/XL size.
review.name: Perfect fit for women

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] For folks who wear glasses, the flaps fit snuggly over your ears. Other branded hats with flaps do not fit snug enough over ears with glasses and allow cold air in. Best hat with flaps and extremely warm.....based on Nebraska winter!
review.name: Best flap hat for folks with glasses and extremely warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just what my daughter wanted for our upcoming trip. It has keep her ears warm the whole time. Hopefully North Face will bring more colors to this item.
review.name: Just need more colors

name: Cragmont Fleece Trapper Hat

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for a binding that was a bit stiffer as my riding has improved so I tried the DODs and I love them! I instantly noticed the difference in response vs. my old bindings and I felt  more in-control and had a better connection to my board. The side supports from the heel-cup to the toe end of the base plate obviously added to this, but they also relieved me from foot pain I experienced with my old set up as my riding became more aggressive. Also, the Aux Tech heel and toe straps literally mold to the shape of my boot which just added that much more stability and comfortability. 

10/10 bindings. I definitely recommend the DODs to anyone who is taking their riding to the next level or just want something comfortable and reliable!
review.name: Very Responsive & Comfy!

name: DOD Snowboard Binding - 2025

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] While looking for a small backpack for my Olympus M43 camera and multiple lenses, the PRVKE 21L bag with camera cube kept coming up in reviews as a great choice. I appreciate that it has both a well padded and highly configurable section for my camera equipment and a large open free space for less sensitive gear. Also, the ability to attach my tripod to the pack really simplifies preparations and hiking. The water resistant materials and well sealed closures are important features to me and have proved their value in just a short time while out in the winter weather. I'm already planning my next purchase of a PRVKE 31L for my larger camera and lenses.
review.name: Great Small Camera Backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this as a gift for my son. The bag is amazing with compartments for lens & gear. Best of all, bag can handle rain or snow. Really easy to handle & load. By far best camera bag.
