review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My son did a ton of comparison research on backpacks and chose this one for his Christmas present. He absolutely loves it and the rest of us do too! Now we each want one. Super cool style and such a specifically engineered, intentional design!! Impressive!
review.name: Love this backpack!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My son asked for this backpack for his photo equipment - it is very well made and heavy duty! Very happy with this purchase
review.name: Backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Full disclosure, my Gen 1 Prvke broke at the zipper after 4 years of heavy use and travel. Wandrd's lifetime warranty is legit - darn you all! The Gen2 Prvke is improved upon and feels even better.
review.name: V2 even better

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag is a game changer, it met every expectation that I had for it. It’s very comfortable for my back, very snug feel. When I’m out in public doing shoots I always get compliments. The compartment are easy to adjust with the interchangeable Velcro padding. 10/10 !
review.name: Bag quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Loving the bag, very comfortable and able to hold all my camera equipment during my trips.
review.name: Great bag!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Wandrd PRVKE series has established itself as a favorite among photographers, travelers, and creatives for its combination of rugged durability, thoughtful design, and stylish aesthetics. The **31-liter PRVKE Backpack** paired with the **Pro Camera Cube** elevates this bag into an excellent choice for those seeking a versatile, camera-focused bag with ample storage and organizational options.---#### **Build Quality and Design**The PRVKE 31L is crafted from **weather-resistant tarpaulin and ballistic nylon**, ensuring durability and protection against the elements. The bag exudes a modern, minimalist aesthetic that appeals to urban explorers and outdoor adventurers alike. Key design elements include:- **Magnetic Tote Handles:** For quick grab-and-go functionality.- **Weatherproof Zippers:** Offer additional protection for gear in inclement weather.- **Expandable Roll Top:** Adds up to 5 liters of extra storage, taking the capacity to 36 liters.The **build quality is outstanding**, with reinforced stitching and robust materials that can handle heavy loads without showing signs of wear.---#### **Comfort and Fit**The PRVKE 31L offers a comfortable carrying experience thanks to its **padded shoulder straps and back panel**. The bag includes an adjustable chest strap, which helps distribute weight evenly. However, users carrying heavy loads for extended periods may notice the absence of a hip belt, which could alleviate pressure on the shoulders.---#### **Storage and Organization**This backpack is incredibly well-organized, catering specifically to photographers and content creators:1. **Pro Camera Cube**: - The Pro Camera Cube is tailored to fit snugly within the main compartment of the PRVKE, providing padded and customizable dividers for gear. - It easily accommodates a **full-frame DSLR or mirrorless camera, along with 3–4 lenses** and additional accessories. - The cube is removable, allowing the bag to transition seamlessly between a photography bag and a regular travel bag.2. **Dedicated Laptop Sleeve**: - Fits laptops up to 16 inches, with padding for protection. - Also includes a tablet sleeve for added utility.3. **Quick-Access Side Pocket**: - Enables fast retrieval of the camera without fully opening the bag.4. **Expandable Roll Top**: - Great for carrying extra clothing or gear for longer trips.5. **Multiple External Pockets**: - Zippered front pockets for small items. - A hidden passport pocket for secure storage of valuables.---#### **Functionality for Photographers**Photographers will appreciate the **side camera access**, allowing quick and discreet access to their camera. The inclusion of the **Pro Camera Cube** ensures gear stays protected and organized. There are attachment points for tripods, and the roll-top design makes it easy to expand storage when carrying additional items like jackets or food.---#### **Versatility**The PRVKE 31L shines as a **multifunctional bag**, transitioning effortlessly from a camera bag to a general-use travel bag. By removing the camera cube, the main compartment transforms into a spacious cavity suitable for clothes, books, or groceries.---#### **Cons**While the PRVKE 31L with the Pro Camera Cube is an excellent option, there are some minor drawbacks:- **Lack of Hip Belt:** Carrying heavy gear over long periods could be more comfortable with a dedicated hip belt.- **Weight:** At 3.4 lbs (1.5 kg) without gear, the bag is on the heavier side due to its durable materials.- **Limited External Accessory Straps:** While there are attachment points, more robust strap options for larger items would be helpful.---#### **Price and Value**At a premium price point, the PRVKE 31L with the Pro Camera Cube offers excellent value for photographers who prioritize durability, organization, and style. While there are cheaper options, few can match the quality and versatility of this bag.---#### **Conclusion**The Wandrd PRVKE 31L with the Pro Camera Cube is a **top-tier backpack** for photographers and travelers seeking a stylish, durable, and functional solution. Its ability to adapt between camera and travel modes, combined with its weatherproof construction and thoughtful design, makes it a standout option. Despite minor drawbacks, it remains a worthwhile investment for those serious about protecting and organizing their gear.**Rating: 9/10** **Best For:** Photographers, urban explorers, and travelers needing a versatile and durable backpack.
review.name: Review of the Wandrd 31 Liter PRVKE with Pro Camera Cube

review.itemreviewed: ZoomX Zegama Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This is my second pair. I love the fit and function. They are wider in the toe box for my wide feet. The are cushioned like Hoka Speedgoats, but have the tread of Salomon Speedcross.

Makes me very sad Nike moved away from this line.
review.name: Love the fit and function!

review.itemreviewed: ZoomX Zegama Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my fourth pair and can put 100s of mies on them and they don't fall apart immediately like so many trail shoes! I wear the tread out before they rip or tear!
review.name: Awesome trail shoe!

review.itemreviewed: ZoomX Zegama Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I have been wearing WildHorse 7 which I loved until I tried these. I have a narrow heel, wide forefoot, low volume (bony) foot. I wear men's for the extra width. I'm the type of running who likes to feel the ground without feeling it (meaning don't like the barefoot shoes). I prefer a good balance between cushion and responsiveness. These are perfect (except for the tongue needs to be longer). Other than that, it has great cushion (more than the Wildhorse), large lugs, great lockdown, and responsiveness is killer. Although it weighs around 10oz, you don't even notice it. Tried it out in the gym while sprinting then did a 5 mile trail run that had varied conditions (rocky, flat, hilly, etc). Had no issues with slippage or traction. 

These are amazing and can't wait to buy another pair.
review.name: Best Trail Shoes

name: ZoomX Zegama Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I'm limited to a 25.4mm seatpost for my 2017 Cannondale Supersix Evo Hi-mod and my options for a 0mm offset seatpost are extremely limited. It works as expected, but the seat clamps can be creaky. It isn't the lightest seatpost out there, and I had to use electrical tape to rig my Di2 batter in place as it isn't Di2 compatible. The seatpost clamp hex screws seem especially shallow and a wrench will slip when tightening if you don't make sure the wrench is seated perfectly flat.
review.name: Solid but can be creaky

name: Service Course SL Carbon Seatpost

review.itemreviewed: C3 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Stretch Mid Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: These gloves kept my fingers pretty warm on rides lasting up to 2-hrs with starting ride temperature at 30°F. I highly recommend these gloves.
review.name: Perfect Fit

review.itemreviewed: C3 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Stretch Mid Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Chicago fall and 38 F°. This glove is not warm at all for this weather. My hands are freezing in twenty minutes. I have to head back to put another layer of thin winter glove. I didn’t like it when I received it because it was tight and weird long fingers. I'm 5'7" 135 Lbs, my hands small and long fingers and glove still tight. I washed after first use. Fabric is softer and easier to put in my hands. Felt like next to my skin. I felt like true size because my hand is small. No problem when used with the phone. I'll keep it for use with temperature around 50 F° and I'll carry another glove if the weather is dropped.
review.name: Felt like next to my skin

review.itemreviewed: C3 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Stretch Mid Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was hoping these gloves could be a liner, but the fingers are very long. I have short fingers, but I have about an inch of excessive length. The rest of the glove is a nice close fit. I bought size small, which is usually my size in men's gloves.
review.name: Very long fingers

review.itemreviewed: C3 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Stretch Mid Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody:
They are snug fitting. Palm side has a stretchy fabric that ensures a tight fit. I have small hands so got the small. Perfect finger length but VERY snug around the base of my fingers, almost uncomfortably so. 

I have been using these for a month or so this winter in NC. Seems to keep my hands fairly dry, but not warm enough for temps approaching freezing. My pinky finger nearly froze on my 15min ride this morning around 30F.  Best used for shoulder season temps above 40F
review.name: Slim fit, marginal warmth

review.itemreviewed: C3 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Stretch Mid Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: They are tight, but stretchy and warm. I wear them on rides around 10-degrees Celsius. The smartphone touch pad works great on my iPhone. Sometimes, too warm as my hands sweat on cold days.
review.name: Perfect fit, perfect protection

review.itemreviewed: C3 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Stretch Mid Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: While I cannot comment on the other reviews as to durability as I've only worn these on three rides, I will say that mine are still in one piece. Further, they have done a great job keeping my fingers toasty on rides down to 43 F with 12 mph winds. They were good in slightly warmer temps without overheating. The stretch is great - no sagging and no tight spots. They fit my hands like, well, like a glove. They felt the tiniest bit snug across my knuckles when I first put them on but I don't notice after two miles. There is fleece on the tops of the fingers where the wind hits one's hands. The "underside" of the hand is thin for good bar feel. I had plenty of grip on my bars and the fingertips worked well on my phone. There is gel padding but it is not that thick and does not cover the whole of the palm. To me it's perfect.
review.name: Nice

review.itemreviewed: C3 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Stretch Mid Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are not bad as a compromise between warmth and thickness. However, don't expect that the promised touchscreen compatible fingertips work. The ones on my gloves fell apart within a few months.
review.name: Not bad thickness, but also not durable

name: C3 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Stretch Mid Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: Over the top sweet, bit nauseating, don't really taste like maple syrup.
review.name: Too sweet

review.reviewBody: Good Taste and provides calories while you ride.
review.name: Good Product

review.reviewBody: I have a sensitive gut and training for a 70.3 and have tried so many gels and products over the years. I have learned through trial and error eat clean with minimal ingredients for best recovery and performance. This stuff is amazing! Packaging is great, easy to digest, no stomach issues and great energy!! I am a huge fan of spring energy as well!!
review.name: Amazing!

review.reviewBody: I love these and have tried many gels and other products.  The taste is awesome and there are no sugary after effects that you can get with other products.  I also use them when traveling as a little extra on a piece of toast or croissant.  I would recommend these to anyone.  The regular and coffee flavors are excellent, I am just starting to try the raspberry ones.
review.name: Great taste and easy on your system

name: Maple Syrup Athletic Fuel

hasVariant.name: Trail Lite Tent: 2-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Trail Lite Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: So I've been working hurricane relief in WNC which is also where I live and bought this tent to sleep in because I was tired of sleeping in the truck and it's great wind hasn't been an issue rain lol snow who cares as always TNF comes thru I 10/10 recommend this tent you could easily put three people in it if need be the rain fly is awesome and comes super low to the ground the footprint is small and makes set up a breeze and can be put in almost anywhere.
review.name: Hurricane Helen approved

review.reviewBody: Super spacious, easy to set up, very lightweight. I like that the sidewalls are more vertical, which is what I was looking for compared to my previous tents. I use this tent for casual car camping, mostly solo but I would feel very comfortable sharing the space with someone and have room to spare for gear. Holds up well in moderate wind and rain. Can't recommend enough!
review.name: Love this tent!

review.reviewBody: Easy to carry, set up, and pack up. Kept us dry and warm! Would recommend for long treks or easy car camping.
review.name: Easy and effective!

review.reviewBody: I already loved the tent for simple backcountry camping. But THEN I brought it to the rough Yukon - at the end of the trip everyone in the group was impressed by my tent. It held against heavy rain, 60km/h wind gusts including sand blow. Best thing: I stepped out in the middle of the night, finding myself ankle-deep in the lake that had risen. BUT everything in the tent kept cozy and dry! That's a statement on water-resistance. Also, it looks really really cool.
review.name: This tent is everything

review.reviewBody: It's light, easy to set up and very cozy for two people
review.name: Nice tent

review.reviewBody: Great tent. Easy ish set up. I managed to get the poles twisted (as they are attached at the cross at the top). Of course I didn't read the instructions. The small tent pole fits well atop the others to improve the offset of the rain fly. Maybe better if the poles were in three pieces but the tent is easily set up following one corner to the next. Happy red tabs assure you are on track from the start with the footprint, tent and rain fly.
review.name: Good tent. Massive for a 2 person. Could easily fit 3.

review.reviewBody: This tent makes camping a breeze! Lightweight, and easy to set up.
review.name: Obsessed with my tent!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really love this tent. I'm not an ultralite backpacker so I don't need something extremely light, but it's still light enough and easy enough to set up that it's ideal to take around to various places. I also love the door and vestibule setup. It seems perfect for two people or one person with extra room. Great color too!
review.name: Perfect solo or 2-person camping tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] 1. Reasonable price 2. Supper WR 3. Light, can put inside backpack 30L 4. Easy to assembling 5. color is TNF signature many many other good points....
review.name: I would like this again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great lite tent for 2. No issues. Would buy again.
review.name: Would buy again...

name: Trail Lite Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

review.itemreviewed: XX1 Eagle DUB SL Crankset - Boost
review.reviewBody: I own two Specialized Sirrus X 5.0 bikes. I installed this same crankset on my 2021 bike and was very satisfied with the upgrade. So much so, that I recently installed this same crankset on my 2024 bike. Keep in mind that these are SRAM components; so they need to be matched with SRAM chains and gear clusters. This upgrade allows for a significant weight loss plus the smooth pedaling of a ceramic bearing bottom bracket. So worth it!
review.name: Excellent Crankset Upgrade

review.itemreviewed: XX1 Eagle DUB SL Crankset - Boost

review.itemreviewed: Ultralight Black Hole Mini 1L Hip Pack
review.reviewBody: This is a great little hip pack. Looks good works great, but enough for my iPhone 7-plus, sunglasses and more. The only thing it could use is a little bit longer straps. It fits me fine, but if I were any bigger it might not. For reference, I am 5?5? and a size 12-14 pants.

review.itemreviewed: Ultralight Black Hole Mini 1L Hip Pack
review.reviewBody: Love this pack. I have been using mine for years. This is Part of my essential travel Bags. My sister loved it so much she bought one for herself too. My husband borrows it all the time too, who weighs a 100 lb more than me. It?s easy to adjust.  I have the all black which matches with everything.
review.name: Quick trips

review.itemreviewed: Ultralight Black Hole Mini 1L Hip Pack
review.reviewBody:
This hip pack is great for when I take my dogs on walks and need to keep my hands free. It typically holds some combination of my Patagonia Houdini windbreaker, chapstick, sunglasses, dog bags, phone, and/or keys. 

I have mixed feelings about using it for hiking. For the purpose of carrying a lightweight packable jacket and gloves, it works great, but any more weight than that and the strap can start to dig into your waist and become uncomfortable after a while. There are lumbar packs with more padding that are better for that purpose, but for lightweight, everyday carry type stuff, this is perfect.
review.name: Perfect for what I needed

review.itemreviewed: Ultralight Black Hole Mini 1L Hip Pack
review.reviewBody: I love this little pack. I?m not too into purses, but this little bag makes for a great little wallet. I can add my credit cards, phone, a small charger, and a small bottle of hand sanitizer.  Then I can wear it, carry it, toss it in a duffel.  Sometimes I wear it on walks to carry dog treats should I not have pockets handy. The multi color one is great.
review.name: Bring back the fanny pack!

name: Ultralight Black Hole Mini 1L Hip Pack

review.reviewBody: Extremely disappointed. These shoes cost way too much for this type of wear. No exaggeration. Literally 2 weeks exactly. Walking only. No runs yet. Light trails. Already show signs of wear. Strips and small chunks of midsole completely fallen off. Dark scuff marks (from what?) on toe caps. HOKA label literally peeling off like a decal. Will be returning. Likely move to another brand. I need shoes that last for at least a reasonable amount of time. Buyer beware.
review.name: 2 weeks of walking. Signs of wear. Logo falling off.

review.reviewBody: After 90 miles.. Good: Lightweight, snug fit, good foam.. Bad: Not breathable at all, laces poor, 5mm lugs too much, toe bumper like nothing.. Notice the description from Hoka does not mention breathable, they get really hot.. Consistently blisters after 6 miles, so these are regulated to short park runs on soft grass, turf. Lugs are peggy, poke into the feet on longer attempts, hard terrain.. If Hoka could improve air flow, lower lugs to 3.5mm, make toe bumper better, it would hit the bullseye..
review.name: Too hot, too many blisters

review.reviewBody: I had the original Zinals and when these came out I was protesting why would they change these. I wasn't going to buy the Zinal2 but I did and these things Rock and without any rocks getting in your shoes. The sock fit is great and these fit like a glove. They are comfortable, rugged and I think perform better than the original Zinal. And they are light weight which makes a difference on trail runs. I bought a half size up and they fit really good and I have a wider foot.
review.name: Don't knock them until you try them...

review.reviewBody: Not lasting. Worn four times on the trails. Name is already tearing off.
review.name: I will not buy again. Looking for something more durable.

review.reviewBody: couldn't tell the fit around the ankle from the pictures... not very comfortable at all. i'm a huge hoka fan but wont buy this model again
review.name: no

review.reviewBody: I needed a new pair of shoes to tackle the Imogene pass trail race a few weeks ago and bought a pair of these Zinals. Great fit, light weight, and excellent traction.
review.name: Love this shoe.

review.reviewBody: Looks great, feels incredibly light, and is plush without feeling unstable. Yet, Hoka just can't seem to figure out how to produce a true to size shoe, particularly in the toe box. After three short runs and less than 15 miles, I gave them away to a friend.
review.name: Same old problem

review.reviewBody: Out of the box....8 miles 2000ft combined elevation gain/loss on rocky singletrack. What more do you want?
review.name: Loooove Them!

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my grandson that works as a patient care technician at a hospital. He walks around constantly for his 12 hour shift. He loves these shoes and said they are working great. He is very picky shoe person so I'm glad these are comfortable.
review.name: Great choice

review.reviewBody: There are many things to love about this shoe. Aggressive tread, light supple and durable upper, light weight, comfortable drop... On paper this is my perfect shoe as it easily doubles between a race shoe and a daily driver. The reality unfortunately is that there are a few shortcomings of this shoe that are hard to overlook, but if changed in V3 could make a truly fantastic shoe. Here are the things I would love to see updated: 1. Laces - the round laces cut into the top of the foot and don't stay tight leaving the shoe feeling either painfully tight, or mushy leaving toes hitting the sides and end of the shoe as the foot slides forward descending. Good news on this one, it's a cheap easy fix that makes the shoe 10x better just swapping to a flat lace. 2. Heel cup - Partially due to the original round lace, but more due to the limited lacing eyelet options my heel refuses to stay put solidly in the heel cup. The overall shape is decent, just doesn't have anything keeping it anchored back into the pocket. Even with an aftermarket insole, and the swapped flat lace it's not perfect leaving my toes with some rub spots after long descents despite 1cm+ in front of the toes when the heel is at the back. 3. The lug pattern of the outsole while being very grippy in most terrain has a tendency to hold mud and not clear between strides. I attribute this to the small spiky prominences added on the sides of the lugs. This adds grip, especially in grass which is great, but not worth the caked mud in my opinion. 4. The responsive foam in this shoe does not match the feel of other Hoka responsive shoes. The underfoot feel of the Zinal 2 is closer to the Speedgoat than it is to the TectonX. I would love to see the foam layup revamped slightly to have a little more energy/firmness in the toe off. Maybe the TectonX 2 and Zinal 2 can have a mashup for V3?! Overall I will keep running in these but won't be buying a second pair sadly.
review.name: So close to fantastic

name: Zinal 2 Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Another genius idea for lightweight backpacking!
Love it!
review.name: Super Packable Bucket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super lightweight and small. Really handy in the backcountry when you have to walk a distance to a water source and can bring some water back to your campsite as it may not be convenient or safe to sit by the water's edge and pump. It's also handy to have a bucket of water hanging off a tree branch next to or near your campfire for safety's sake. Lastly, instead of dunking your JetBoil in a river to fill it up, just dip the STS folding bucket and then transfer the water to your jetboil. It folds down so small and weighs nothing. The biggest challenge is loosing it in your backpack because it's so small and remembering how to fold it up to put it back in it's case.
review.name: Really handy bucket is super small and weighs nothing.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lightweight and packable. My friend has this and we’ve used it many camping & backpacking trips so I decided I needed one myself. Pro tip: WASH BEFORE USING - terrible manufacture taste the first couple of uses!
review.name: Won’t backpack or camp without it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have yet to use this folding bucket on the trail, but I have used it when camping as an additional water source. I hung it up and it worked great to dip my measuring cup into when preparing oatmeal and other dishes. Much faster than using my plastic water holder with a spigot!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] When slightly filled ---it seems to strain to stay upright. Best used as a hanging option rather than free standing Super light though and packs super small.
review.name: Light but better as a hanging option rather than free standing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag is super lightweight and holds water well without leaking. It is compact and perfect for taking backpacking to use for getting water from a shallow source to use your filter.
review.name: Great for backpacking! Lightweight and compact!

review.reviewBody: I'm amazed how this bucket can almost be hidden in the palm my hand when compressed but opens up to hold approximately 2 U.S. gallons. Well made. Very pleased with this product. I own three which are used in our families emergency "Go Bags".
review.name: I'm amazed how this bucket

review.reviewBody:
Love this super compact, light, and useful folding bucket. We take it on all our backpacking trips and use it for almost every meal. It's great for grabbing water from a river or lake, and then we gently pour water from the bucket through a filter that takes out all the bugs and dirt, and into a large container. From there I add a pill to get rid of the microscopic bugs and potential sources of illness.
This is totally perfect.
review.name: Perfect for backpacking

review.reviewBody: This was a last minute purchase before a backpacking trip and I was so glad I got it! It was very useful and we ended up using it a lot. It is super light weight and folds up into a tiny little pouch. This will definitely be a camping and backpacking staple to have with us.
review.name: Very Useful

review.reviewBody: Took this on JMT thru hike for general washing up at evening camp as well as doing light laundry. Incredibly light and easy to throw in a ziploc with some Wilderness Wash and a cord for clothes. Only challenge is it is not freestanding so needed to hang it from a log etc or hold the handles with one hand to keep the water from spilling out.
review.name: Essential camp wash took

review.reviewBody: Easy set up, affordable, spacious. Only cons were that the zippers on both the tent and the rain cover stuck a little bit, and there is no footprint, but not a huge deal. I've used this twice, the first time there were torrential downpours for most of the night, and no water got in top or bottom. There are some negative reviews saying they wouldn't want this on a mountain in winter or whatever, but if you're buying a 4 person tent for under $100, you are most likely car camping once or twice a year, this will work great.
review.name: Great value

review.reviewBody: this tent is fairly mediocre, materials used to make it are kind of cheap and flimsy. I definitely wouldn't want to use this in 3-season weather. The interior fabric was fraying, leaving little strings of thread all over the place, and overall just doesn't stand up very well to wind and rain. The zippers get stuck constantly. I got it on sale or with a discount for under $100 so I got some use out of it. I would definitely recommend paying more money to get a better tent if you need a quality experience. if you want a cheap tent for a limited use (music festival camping) it's probably fine if you can get it on sale.
review.name: "You get what you pay for"

review.reviewBody: It's a great tent! It goes up and comes down very easy and fast. Perfect for dogs because the mesh does not go all the way down and therefore eliminates the possibility of the mesh being scratched/ripped. Only suggestion is for the stakes to be a little stronger, but that's minor. Love it!
review.name: Great tent!

review.reviewBody: The tent was fine, but the rain fly only had 3 corner buckles, with a giant loop at the fourth corner, so it is not possible to anchor the rain fly to the framework. Returned defective item.
review.name: Missing Parts

review.reviewBody: Go with a quality brand if you actually want to go camping.  This is a fair weather children's play tent for the backyard. If you need to camp in foul weather make sure you seam seal it first and pray.  You get what you pay for.
review.name: Children's Play Tent

review.reviewBody:
We used the tent for the first time this weekend. We got rain in the middle of the night and it held very well. No leaks. Very easy to pitch by one person. 
I give it 4 stars because the stakes are aluminum and very bad quality. They bend unless you are pitching the tent on a patch of grass
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: I bought this tent on sale as a great car camping tent for me and my dog (and often a friend and their dog). Very spacious, easy to assemble with one person camped in it in snow and summer conditions.   I did recently have my fly punctured when the wind carried my tent away but besides that, it's been good to me especially considering the price.
review.name: Great spacious tent for the price

review.reviewBody: During a trip with this tent, our campsite flooded during a storm… we had 3-4 inches of standing water around our tent. The bottom turned into a waterbed as the water flowed underneath our tent. However there was not a single DROP of water inside our tent. We stayed completely dry even though we were sitting in water for almost an hour! I was completely blown away. For the price, this tent is incredibly high quality.
review.name: Amazing waterproofing

review.reviewBody: I have multiple tents that range from Big Agness, Eurika, Six Moon, Coleman, Rural King, and the Stoic.  I've had the Stoic Madrone 4, four years now and it has always performed well for me.  Unfortunately, one of the tent poles split the last time I was out, and Back Country does not carry replacements poles.  My only option is to use a tent pole splint or replace the tent.
review.name: I really like this tent but...

review.reviewBody: Bought this to camp in the backyard with my 3 yr old grandkids. So far so good.  Even when we got stuck in the rain. Kept us dry with the fly. Plenty of room to even add the dog
review.name: Jeff N

name: Madrone 4 Tent: 4-person 3-season
